page.title: 15FEERING SCHOOL
page.content: {Feering school }is an old school, it is smaller than {St.Marys in Kelvedon. The{school}is much taller than ours.They have lots of problems like they haven't got a sports hall. They have got two plaques on the walls of two rooms they are; {DRUMOND ROOM IN {MEMORY OF REV. R. DRUMOND. VICAR OF {FEERING 1830-1880 }the other plaque says;{PACKE ROOM IN MEMORY OF REV. {W.J. PACKE VICAR OF FEERING {1881-1909.}There are only 25 children in each junior class, and in the infants they like to keep the number of children below 20 so altogether there are 70_80 children. There is going to be a new school built about Chistmas because the old one is falling apart. It is going to be built on part of Rye Mill Lane playing field.
